item.title: Coronavirus: Millions more to be eligible for testing
item.description: Staff and residents of care homes in England, and over 65s, can be tested, the health secretary says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Care home deaths up as hospital cases fall
item.description: Outbreaks in care homes claiming 2,000 lives a week, but hospital fatalities are going down.

item.title: British Airways to cut up to 12,000 jobs as air travel collapses
item.description: The UK flag carrier says a collapse in air travel due to coronavirus means a huge restructuring is needed.

item.title: Coronavirus: Evening update as testing extended to over-65s with symptoms
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this evening.

item.title: Coronavirus: The hospice staff working through a pandemic
item.description: We go inside East Cheshire Hospice to see how staff, patients and families are coping with the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scottish government suggests covering face in shops
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon says there may be "some benefit" in wearing a cloth face covering in enclosed areas.

item.title: Coronavirus: Royal Navy submarine lockdown party captain sacked
item.description: Following an investigation the Royal Navy says Cmdr John Lewis of HMS Trenchant was relieved of command.

item.title: Millions fall silent for key workers
item.description: The UK joined together to commemorate the front-line workers who have died with coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lockdown exit must take domestic abuse rise into account - May
item.description: The government must think how lockdown impacts domestic violence as it plans an exit, says former PM.

item.title: Coronavirus: Brothers die on same day in Newport
item.description: Their father had died just three weeks earlier with an unrelated condition.

item.title: McDonald’s trials UK branch reopening amid lockdown
item.description: McDonald’s is testing reopening a UK branch this week, but it’s behind closed doors.

item.title: Former school inspector rates own home schooling 'atrocious'
item.description: Andrew Jeffrey writes a mock Ofsted report describing teachers in dressing gowns and pupils playing Fortnite.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'My son had symptoms of rare syndrome'
item.description: Hayley Grix's three-year-old son Marley became extremely unwell with distressing symptoms.

item.title: Pentagon releases UFO videos for the record
item.description: The hovering objects seen in the footage are still classified as "unidentified".

item.title: Disney sparks backlash with #MayThe4th tweet
item.description: The company suggested it owned the rights to any tweet containing the hashtag.

item.title: Penelope West, 5, fundraises as her favourite princesses
item.description: Five-year-old Penelope West, from Hassocks, walked 10 miles in five days in fancy dress.

item.title: Coronavirus: The weekly shop is back in fashion, says Tesco boss
item.description: Supermarket boss Dave Lewis says shopping trips are less frequent but basket sizes have doubled.

item.title: Ethereal image of Cosmos flowers wins photo competition
item.description: A photo of Cosmos flowers wins the International Garden Photographer of the Year's Black & White photo project.

item.title: Coronavirus: Families foster pets during outbreak
item.description: As animal shelters are forced to limit operations, many people have applied to temporarily rehome a pet.

item.title: Coronavirus: What Trump voters think of his handling of crisis
item.description: "Dumbfounded" or "great job" - Americans who backed the president in 2016 rate his pandemic response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Florida pastor continues in-person services
item.description: Pastor Rich Vera is among a minority in America who say it’s appropriate to gather to worship.

item.title: Coronavirus: How the lockdown is affecting 5 Live callers
item.description: Three listeners tell Nicky Campbell about the impact of coronavirus on them and their families.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I ran the London Marathon on my treadmill'
item.description: Complete with fake London landmarks and commentary from legendary voice of the marathon Steve Cram.

item.title: Kim Jong-un: Who might lead N Korea without Kim?
item.description: The enigmatic sister and a spymaster are contenders, as rumours swirl over Kim Jong-un's health.

item.title: Coronavirus: Which regions have been worst hit?
item.description: Reality Check examines the weekly deaths figures for nations and regions across the UK.

item.title: The Uber driver evicted from home and left to die of coronavirus
item.description: Rajesh Jayaseelan found himself homeless and sick in London with Covid-19. His widow tells his story.

item.title: Coronavirus immunity: Can you catch it twice?
item.description: Immunity is the crucial question and understanding it will tell us how the pandemic will end.

item.title: Normal People: When book adaptations go right
item.description: The TV adaptation of Sally Rooney's novel Normal People gets rave reviews from critics.

item.title: TV in lockdown: How shows are coping without a studio audience
item.description: Some TV shows are struggling without a crowd - but others have arguably improved.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are people still flying into the UK? And other questions
item.description: Why are people still flying into the UK, and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'We aren't diagnosing many cancers now'
item.description: Planned surgery has been cancelled across the NHS - there may be some big changes when it resumes.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I returned my suits and spent £100 on joggers'
item.description: Demand for casual clothing is soaring during the lockdown, but is the UK at risk of dressing down too much?

item.title: Stressed firms look for better ways to source products
item.description: The way firms get their raw materials may change rapidly now Covid-19 has disrupted supply chains.

item.title: Don't restart season but be ready for new campaign - Fifa medical chief
item.description: Fifa's chief doctor warns against restarting the interrupted 2019-20 campaign and suggests governing bodies prepare for action next season.

item.title: Ligue 1 & 2: France's top two divisions will not resume this season
item.description: The Ligue 1 and Ligue 2 seasons will not resume after France bans all sporting events, including behind closed doors, until September.

item.title: Derby County players and staff agree wage deferral amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Championship side Derby County say first team players and staff have agreed a "substantial" wage deferral.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics 'will not be postponed again'
item.description: The postponed Tokyo Olympics will be "scrapped" if they cannot take place in 2021, says Games chief Yoshiro Mori.

item.title: Uefa wants leagues to decide by 25 May whether they will complete season
item.description: European leagues are asked to tell Uefa by 25 May whether they want to complete or cancel their seasons.

item.title: Spanish stars lead tributes after ex-Liverpool striker & broadcaster Robinson dies at 61
item.description: Former Liverpool and Republic of Ireland striker Michael Robinson dies at the age of 61.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should the public wear face masks?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus: How close is the UK to 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: A visual guide to the economic impact
item.description: Key maps and charts explain how the virus has impacted markets and businesses around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus – explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to wash your hands - in 20 seconds
item.description: Dr Adele McCormick from the University of Westminster demonstrates how to wash your hands.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: ‘I was a teacher for 17 years, but I couldn’t read or write’
item.description: John Corcoran graduated from university and became a teacher for 17 years - but he had an extraordinary secret.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: 'Nobody told us about the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: Before setting sail around the world, Elena and Ryan told their families not to give them bad news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting the 'one in a million' girl
item.description: Bex Price's family went into isolation early as coronavirus would almost certainly kill her.

item.title: Coronavirus: Making face masks feels 'like the war effort'
item.description: Thousands of people are producing cloth masks, despite UK authorities saying they are unnecessary.

item.title: Coronavirus journey: The 'last cruise ship on Earth' finally comes home
item.description: From political storms to presidential pleas, it has been quite a journey for the MSC Magnifica.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: How Typhoid Mary left a trail of scandal and death
item.description: The chilling story of an Irish immigrant cook who brought typhoid to well-to-do families in New York.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: A coronavirus survivor's story: 'I touched death'
item.description: Elizabeth says she feels lucky to be alive after falling seriously ill with the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
item.description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.
